title: Mata insists it is harder than ever to break into Premier League top four
text:
Manchester United midfielder Juan Mata believes it is 'more difficult' than ever to break into the top four in the Premier League.

United have let their standards slip this season this season and sit 12th in the table after winning just two of their first eight games this season.

Red Devils boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is under pressure after last week's abject 1-0 defeat at Newcastle, but Mata says top flight clubs are improving every year.

Manchester United's Juan Mata believes it is 'more difficult' than ever to break into the top four

'I think every club is improving and clubs like Leicester are recruiting really well and they have very good players that can take them to a different level,' Mata told Sky Sports.

'Not long ago (Leicester) won the Premier League so they know what it takes to win.

'Football is more difficult now because every club is growing a lot so it's more competitive and every club is able to sign good players. So you have to be better every single season to try and reach your aims.'

United return to action after the international break on October 20 when they take on Liverpool at home.
description: Manchester United midfielder Juan Mata believes it is 'more difficult' than ever to break into the top four in the Premier League. United have let their standards slip this season this season.
